title: max_file_size bug to fix
body:
transferred from bug-genie:
http://bugs.owncloud.org/thebuggenie/owncloud/issues/oc-1972

while i know we have big file chunking, there is no use of it in the web interface, so this problem persists.

i was able to repeat it with an error given of "exceeds max_file_size specified in form"

description:
hi to owncloud team,

i want to speak you about a bug on upload with a big max_file_size in php.ini. i want to upload so big videos on my owncloud, with a size > 5gb, then i put my max_file_size to 10gb in php.ini and post_max_size to 20gb. when i upload the file there is a max_file_size bug shown on the screen while my upload is 3gb, or 100kb

by changing max_file_size i have understood if max_file_size is greater than 4g (in fact max integer size), the application said there is a max_file_size problem with my upload, you should fix integer to use a 64 bytes integer instead of 32 bytes integer (which is limited by large files).

thanks.


reproduction steps:

    set max_file_size to 10g in php.ini & restart apache
    upload a file (size is not a problem)
    there is the error
    set max_file_size to 1g
    upload the same file
    no problem
